Friday, when I arrived at the hotel, I took Beau out on his leash, walked up to the hotel to check in and I was greeted by a man. He looked down and said, "You aren't staying here are you?" I said, "As a matter of fact I am." I walked past him and to the check in counter. As I approached I was greeted with stares and the girl behind the counter said, "You aren't staying here with that dog, he is over 25 pounds." Beau weighs maybe 45 pounds, stands to my knee on all four paws and would lick you to death before he would hurt you. Now, I had just been in a car with a dog for an hour and a half, had to make a pee stop too, so I was getting a little peeved. I told the girl that the weight issue was not stated at the time of reservation and I was staying. The man that first greeted me became a little angered and said, "Not in his hotel!" Finally I said fine, I will just go home. This was a mistake to begin with. I went outside and called D. I told him they wouldn't let me stay at the hotel, blah, blah, blah....and I was going home. Boy, did he get mad. After a few unfriendly words, ending with, "You do what you have to do and call me back." I went back in the hotel to cancel my reservation. The girl got a confused look on her face and said I didn't have one under my name. I told her to look again and to also check for Digger. At that time I looked down at a table that was near the counter. On the table was a flyer. On the flyer was the address for the hotel I was standing in. I turned pink with embarrassment. I was at the wrong hotel. After we had a good laugh, they gave me directions to the right place and I left. When I checked into the correct hotel, I left Beau in the car. Now for the hotel..... As I drove up to the hotel, it occurred to me why I missed it. This "Palace" that we would be staying at for the next two nights was located behind a vacant looking building and a used car dealership. The front lot had broken down vehicles in it and one of the signs on the front was missing. I drove around the back of the vacant building and left Beau in the car as I went in to check in. The lobby was a sparse room, with chipped tile in the front doorway. Computer printer paper signs were everywhere. You know the kind I mean...word format documents with 72 font words in black. It was alright though, it looked like they were under new management and were trying to clean the place up. The floor was clean and you could see spots that new plaster had been applied to the walls. Keycard in hand I went back to my car and drove around the back of the building. Ohhh, bad mistake. I counted 7 cars that had no wheels, really the entire wheel was gone, 1 had windows busted out and several that didn't look like they had been drivin in quite some time. I finally found my room, fabulous!, overlooking the pool. I took Beau up first. I wanted to get him out of site, just in case it turned out to be a problem to have him there. As I opened the door I told myself to have an openmind. My first impression was it smelled clean. Then I looked around and it looked clean. I turned on all the lights and inspected closer. King bed, clean(appeared) sheets, could see vacuum marks on carpet, several towels(older, but clean), new soap, new TP, fridge, microwave, TV....ok, I have been in worse. I must commend them, I didn't see any evidence of roaches and there were no mouse traps to be found. After getting all the gear in and feeding Beau I stepped out to the landing. I watched a couple kids splash around in the pool for awhile and started to go back to my room. I will say, if you want to stay cheaply in BR and you don't care what kind of atmosphere you have, then I recommend the place. But if you can't tolerate, pimps, their workers, drug addicts and homeless, don't stay there. As I walked back to my room, I got a warm whistle from a nice gentleman all dressed in nastyness, the evil eye from the cute girl who was wearing a flowing yellow cotton mini with matching 3 inch sandals that laced up her leg and a "you new here?" from the nice lady on her way to the laundry facility with 3 youngin's in tow. Don't get me wrong, I really did have a good time. I wouldn't care if I was camping in the woods, as long as D was there. Spending some time with him was 80% of the purpose for this trip. The other 20% was to see the boys play ball. And they played, two game elimination and they played two games. That is all I will say about that! Now I am home, okay, really I am at my sister's. Beau is feeling glad to be home, but I am sure he will miss sleeping with me. It was very warm with both him and D in bed with me. I was wedged between them most of the time. And ya know something, I wouldn't trade this past weekend for anything. I really had a good time.

Ya'll have a great weekend and don't do anything I wouldn't!! Heheeeee!

Yesterday was my one year anniversary to Blogging. Happy Anniversary to me! A lot has evolved in my life since then. I have gone thru several relations, made many mistakes but all in all, I have come thru it a better person. I still have my bouts of self-pity and my doubts as to whether I am doing it the right way for me, but that is part of life. Sometimes I want to just throw my hands up and say WTF. I am in a low spot right now. And I wonder how long it will last. I have friends that have spoken out that they are just giving up. They claim to have tried and nothing has worked, so they are sitting in their hell of a life and letting it take over. I don't want to do that. I am going to be 40 this year, in 5 months. I wonder what is out there for me. I am not like my friends, I am older and I have been through more bumps. Someone very close to me became upset with me the other day. She yelled at me that I have someone and she has nothing. She is wrong about that. She has everything. She is 27, single, beautiful, smart, has a college degree, lives in her own place and can do whatever her heart desires. She chooses to be alone. She may argue that, but it is true. The ones she goes out with, has a limited relationship with or does anything with are incapable of committing to her fully. They are bad boys. Those are her choices and so she is alone. My choice is companionship. Someone that is compatible with me in every way. Someone I don't have to change for. Someone that does not expect me to be anything but me. That is why I am not alone, most times. I know she was a little jealous of what I have. I don't think she really thought it out before she spoke. She does really know the sacrifices that I had to make within myself to have what I have. Anyway...Blah...starting to depress myself even more. I am gonna just stop right there...I feel like I am repeating myself too. Sooooo, Happy Anniversary to me and Happy 4th of July, independence Day, to us all!!

Posted Via Email: Saturday I went to the Pub. Yeah, go figure....seriously, it had been 3 weeks and they missed me. Anyway, I get there and I am on my way to being toast. I am sitting at the bar, waiting for my name to be called and Louie sits next to me. Louie is a cute, young, taller version of Mr. Atlanta. Louie is all of 27, married, has a 2 year old daughter, works his ass off and is lonely. His wife was sitting on the other side of the room, yacking her head off to who ever about what ever. Before I realized where the conversation was heading he turned to me and said, "You do know I am very attracted to you and you tempt me every time I see you". I wasn't surprised. Louie and I met about a year ago and there was a sizzle then, but I behaved and left him alone. We sat there and talked for a couple hours, pausing long enough to go up and sing and for me to share conversation with Jenn. He confessed that he is miserable and only stays where he is because of his little girl. I listened and then told him what I tell all the miserably married men in my life. "Baby, you got to do what makes you happy, cuz bottom line that is all that matters." He ended up getting a call from the babysitter and he left. His wife stayed and drank and socialized with her friends. I didn't stay much longer than that. I was severely over-served. On my way home I called Dig. The alcohol, the witnessing of the way Louie's wife treated him, the listening to Dig talk about his, my being alone at the time and afraid that Dig and his would make amends and he would leave me all came to a head and I lost all emotional control. I blubbered like a baby, then cried myself to sleep.
